Key Match Events: Brooklyn Nets jumped out to a quick 11-0 lead behind triples from D'Angelo Russell and Ziaire Williams.
Philadelphia 76ers responded with a 9-0 run, spearheaded by Joel Embiid after an early technical foul.
Joel Embiid scored 17 points in the game's opening 24 minutes.
Caleb Martin and Paul George contributed 17 and 14 points respectively for the 76ers.
Tosan Evbuomwan made his first official NBA appearance for the Brooklyn Nets.
Brooklyn Nets committed 22 turnovers, leading to 32 points conceded off those miscues.
Brooklyn Nets shot 34.1% from beyond the arc.
Brooklyn Nets did not record a single scorer over the 20-point threshold.
Pre-Game Insights: Brooklyn Nets were missing Cam Thomas, Cam Johnson, and Ben Simmons due to injury.
Joel Embiid was listed as active for the Philadelphia 76ers.
Post-Match Reflections: Brooklyn Nets announced that D'Angelo Russell would miss the remainder of the contest with a right shin contusion.
Brooklyn Nets' performance was hindered by injuries and turnovers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brooklyn Nets' record dropped to 13-22 on the season.
Brooklyn Nets look toward two straight home matchups with the Indiana Pacers and Detroit Pistons next week.
